meanings.definition: To identify too closely with someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She was overidentifying with her favorite character in the book.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overidentify with his sports team, feeling their wins and losses deeply.
meanings.sent3: The little girl was overidentifying with her toy, pretending it could talk.
meanings.sent4: He was overidentifying with the hero in the movie, believing he could also perform heroic feats.
meanings.sent5: The student was overidentifying with the historical figure, dressing like them for the school play.

meanings.definition: To attribute too much importance or significance to something.
meanings.sent1: She was overidentifying the outcome of the game with her happiness.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overidentify his self-worth with his job performance.
meanings.sent3: The child was overidentifying the drawing of a stick figure as a masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The artist was overidentifying a simple brushstroke with deep meaning.
meanings.sent5: The student was overidentifying a single test score with their entire academic future.

meanings.definition: To recognize or establish the identity of something with excessive certainty.
meanings.sent1: She was overidentifying the suspect in the lineup, convinced it was him.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overidentify the sound of the wind with ghostly whispers.
meanings.sent3: The scientist was overidentifying the new species, claiming it was a rare find.
meanings.sent4: The detective was overidentifying the clue, thinking it was the key to the case.
meanings.sent5: The expert was overidentifying the painting as an original, without any doubt.
